required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnosis and Treatment of Sleep Apnea in Cerebrovascular Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnosis and Treatment of Sleep Apnea in Cerebrovascular Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: Sleep apnea is common among Veterans with cerebrovascular disease (stroke or transient ischemic attack [TIA]), leads to hypertension, and is associated with recurrent stroke and death. Although continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) safely treats sleep apnea, few Veterans with cerebrovascular disease are diagnosed with sleep apnea or offered treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The project sought to evaluate whether a diagnostic and therapeutic intervention strategy among Veterans with cerebrovascular disease and hypertension using unattended polysomnography and auto-titrating CPAP with a targeted adherence evaluation and educational protocol resulted in: an improved rate of diagnosed sleep apnea, an improved rate of treated sleep apnea, and improved blood pressure control.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The entire study period (baseline and up to one-year)
primary_outcome.description: The number of patients with a diagnosis of sleep apnea

arm_group.description: The intervention group received unattended polysomnography and auto-titrating CPAP if sleep apnea was diagnosed
The control group received usual clinical care which may include receipt of sleep diagnostic and therapeutic services

intervention.intervention_name: CPAP Therapy for Newly Diagnosed Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA)
intervention.description: Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) is provided for those patients who are diagnosed with OSA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack Hypertension
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior diagnosis of sleep apnea or other sleep disorder
- Life expectancy < 6 months or Hospice
- Non-English speaker
- Unable/unwilling to use mask
- Inability to give informed consent
- Oxygen dependent COPD
- Chronic renal failure with dialysis
- Active Suicidal Ideation

overall_official.affiliation: Richard L. Roudebush VA Medical Center, Indianapolis, IN

facility.name: VA Connecticut Healthcare System West Haven Campus, West Haven, CT
Richard L. Roudebush VA Medical Center, Indianapolis, IN

group.title: Intervention
group.description: The intervention group received unattended polysomnography and auto-titrating CPAP if sleep apnea was diagnosed

group.title: Control
group.description: The control group received usual clinical care which may include receipt of sleep diagnostic and therapeutic services

outcome.title: Sleep Apnea Diagnosis Rate
outcome.description: The number of patients with a diagnosis of sleep apnea
outcome.time_frame: The entire study period (baseline and up to one-year)
outcome.population: The intervention patients had polysomnography at baseline (n=102) whereas control patients either had polysomnography as part of usual care (n=7) or at the end of the study as part of the study protocol (n=85). The n=7 patients who had polysomnography as part of usual care were included in the analysis for this outcome.

measure.title: Sleep Apnea Diagnosis Rate
measure.description: The number of patients with a diagnosis of sleep apnea
measure.population: The intervention patients had polysomnography at baseline (n=102) whereas control patients either had polysomnography as part of usual care (n=7) or at the end of the study as part of the study protocol (n=85). The n=7 patients who had polysomnography as part of usual care were included in the analysis for this outcome.

outcome.title: Sleep Apnea Treatment Rate
outcome.population: Among the 58 intervention patients with a diagnosis of sleep apnea, CPAP data were available for 57. Among the 7 control patients who received polysomnography as part of usual care, 5 had sleep apnea: CPAP data were available for 4 patients (2 did not receive any CPAP and 2 had CPAP therapy), the data card was unavailable for 1 patient.

measure.title: Sleep Apnea Treatment Rate
measure.population: Among the 58 intervention patients with a diagnosis of sleep apnea, CPAP data were available for 57. Among the 7 control patients who received polysomnography as part of usual care, 5 had sleep apnea: CPAP data were available for 4 patients (2 did not receive any CPAP and 2 had CPAP therapy), the data card was unavailable for 1 patient.

event.description: new stroke event in patient with history of cerebrovascular disease

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
